reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sam Esmail', 'Jim McKay', 'Tricia Brock', 'Deborah Chow', 'Nisha Ganatra', 'Niels Arden Oplev', 'Christoph Schrewe'], 'Producers': ['Sam Esmail', 'Kyle Bradstreet', 'Steve Golin', 'Chad Hamilton'], 'Starring': ['Rami Malek', 'Christian Slater']} Pretty clever plot lines (though not always realistic) and very good acting. Far more interesting than you think a "hacker" drama would be. Definitely R-rated and pushes the limit of that at times. I'll keep watching on Amazon Prime. Better than expected for a hacker drama {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rob Rapley'], 'Producers': ['Rob Rapley', 'Stephanie Haberman Bordas', 'Kathryn Lord'], 'Starring': ['Michael Murphy', 'Shuler Hensley', 'Kathryn Erbe'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} Lots of info about presidents Garfield and Arthur I never knew. Garfield could have been one of the best presidents ever. Looks like his doctor did more to kill him than the guy who shot him. Good acting in the docu-drama parts. Very engrossing. Well worth your time if you like learning little known history. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Paul Giamatti', 'Laura Linney', 'Stephen Dilane'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Johnny A finally gets his due! And Abigail too!
Fantastic acting. Great production quality for a period piece.
Adams, Jefferson, Washington, Hamilton, and Franklin are all here. Entertaining and educational! All the founding fathers excellently portrayed--but Abigail steals the show! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bill Condon'], 'Producers': ['Anne Carey', 'Iain Canning', 'Emile Sherman', 'Len Blavatnik', 'Aviv Giladi', 'Vince Holden', 'Christine Langan', 'Zanne Devine', 'Amy Nauiokas'], 'Starring': ['Ian McKellen', 'Laura Linney', 'Hiroyuki Sanada'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} Great acting but devoid of any action or intrigue. This is a drama about a retired Sherlock slipping into senility. Mystery fans will be disappointed. Boring but well-acted drama. Not a Sherlock mystery movie. Heist Suspense, Action, Cerebral, Intense ["A casino card dealer, desperate to pay for his daughter's life-saving surgery, teams up with a co-worker to pull off a casino heist, but as the plan falters they find themselves hijacking a bus and using the hostages as collateral."] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Scott Mann'], 'Producers': ['Randall Emmett', 'George Furla', 'Wayne Marc Godfrey', 'Robert Jones', 'Stephen Sepher', 'Alexander Tabrizi'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Jeffrey Dean Morgan', 'Robert De Niro']} Major plot flaws in an otherwise clever heist film. Despite that, it was worth watching (for free with Prime membership). This is not a DeNiro caliber film--but somewhat enjoyable. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sam Raimi'], 'Producers': ['Tom Rosenberg', 'James Jacks', 'Gary Lucchesi', 'Robert G. Tapert', 'Rob Tapert'], 'Starring': ['Keanu Reeves', 'Cate Blanchett', 'Hilary Swank']} Superstar line-up delivers good acting in this redneck-ESP thriller. Keanu makes a good bad guy. Good ESP-crime-mystery drama {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susanne Bier'], 'Producers': ['Susanne Bier', 'Khadija Alami', 'Alexei Boltho', 'Rob Bullock', 'Simon Cornwell', 'Stephen Cornwell', 'Sam Englebardt', 'José Luis Escolar', 'David Farr', 'Brian Flanagan'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Laurie', 'Tom Hiddleston', 'Nader Boussandel']} Hugh Laurie is great. A good 6-episode drama.
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user maintains a strong interest in mature-rated content, particularly in narratives that blend technology, hacking, and thrillers. They appreciate dynamic storytelling in suspenseful genres while also enjoying historical docu-dramas.

- **Genre Affinity:** Recently, the user has adopted a more critical stance towards suspense-action films, emphasizing the need for engaging plots alongside thrilling sequences. A recent rating reflects this shift, as they rated a heist film lower due to its lackluster narrative.

- **Quality of Production:** The user has high standards for acting and production quality, seeking a balance between strong performances and captivating narratives. Their reviews highlight satisfaction with talented casts while underscoring the importance of plot alignment with expectations for excitement.

- **Platform Engagement:** An avid consumer of streaming services like Amazon Prime, the user explores a diverse range of content.

- **Content Advisory Awareness:** Comfortable with adult themes such as violence and substance use, they seek boundary-pushing narratives that challenge norms.

- **Rating Behavior:** While the user typically maintains an average rating of around 4.5, they have become more discerning, reflecting this in their recent lower ratings for content with unsatisfactory plots. Their latest review praised a drama for its performances while still emphasizing the importance of overall narrative quality.

Overall, the user's profile reflects a refined pursuit of high-quality dramas that offer both action and informative historical narratives, alongside a critical lens for engaging storytelling.
